task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 150°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will first look up to find the roof.
My heading has unexpectedly changed to 0° North; I need to rotate back to the building at 150° South-East to continue the task.
I am looking down at the base of the building; I need to look up to see the roof to estimate the full height.
My heading has reset to North again; I need to rotate back to the building at 150° and look up to see the roof.
I am facing the building but need to see the top to estimate its height, so I will look up.
My heading has reset to North again; I must rotate back to 150° to face the building and keep my upward pitch to see the roof.
I need to see the full vertical extent of the building, so I will first look down to establish the ground level and then look up to the roof.
My heading has reset to North again; I need to rotate back to 150° to face the building and then look up to see the roof.
I can see the top part of the building, but to get a full sense of its height, I need to look down towards the base again.
My heading has reset to North and I'm looking straight down; I need to rotate back to face the building at 150° and reset my pitch to a neutral view to re-evaluate.
I am looking at the very top of the building; now I need to look down to see the base to get a complete view for my estimation.
I need to return to the 150° heading to see the building and its base clearly to estimate the height.
I am looking at the top of the building; I will now look down to see the base to get a full view and make an estimation.

I have now viewed the building from its base to its roof over several steps; using the visible floors as a reference, where each floor is approximately 3-4 meters, I estimate the building is about 8 stories tall, leading to a total height of around 28 meters.
